The NHL will force erstwhile All-Stars Pavel Datsyuk and Nicklas Lidstrom to miss the Detroit Red Wings' first game after the All-Star break for failing to attend this weekend's festivities.

 The pair will miss the Red Wings regular-season game against the Columbus Blue Jackets under a policy established last year, Colin Campbell, the NHL's senior executive vice president of hockey operations, said Friday.

Sidney Crosby, on the other hand, will not miss the Pittsburgh Penguins' next game because he was in attendance in Montreal, even though it was announced Thursday he would not take part in on-ice activities during All-Star Weekend as he rests an injured left knee.

 Campbell said he felt bad for Lidstrom, who has played in 10 All-Star games and often brings his family to the event.

"Unfortunately he's caught up in this," Campbell said.

But, the league's top disciplinarian said, players who are voted or named to All-Star rosters have an obligation to attend if they aren't injured. 

Detroit GM Ken Holland said Lidstrom, 38, has been dealing with tendinitis for a number of seasons and wanted to use the All-Star break to try and get into a position where he can play pain-free down the stretch. Holland knew there was the potential for Lidstrom to miss a game after the break, but didn't pressure his star defenseman to play.

"Nik Lidstrom has been an incredible ambassador for our team and for our game. I respect his decision," Holland told ESPN.com on Friday.

Holland was less enthusiastic about the policy that will sit his star defenseman for a game. "I disagree with the decision, but I'm not running the league," he said.

Tuesday's game is looming as a difficult outing for the Central Division-leading Wings, as Holland said they might be without defenseman Brad Stuart and forward Johan Franzen as well.

NHL commissioner Gary Bettman imposed the policy, established at last year's general managers meetings, to legitimize injury claims and improve All-Star Weekend attendance. The policy states All-Stars who are injured must have missed at least the last game before the All-Star break in order to be excused; otherwise, they must sit out the first regular-season game after the break.

 Former NHL goalie Glenn Healy, now director of player affairs for the NHLPA, disagrees with the league's stance on the issue. He said the league needs to look at the big picture.

 "It's not good for hockey and it's not good for the fans," if Lidstrom and Datsyuk are held out of play, Healy said.

 Players invited to the YoungStars competition are still exempt from the policy, and several have bowed out of the event, including Columbus goalie Steve Mason and Washington center Nicklas Backstrom.

 Campbell said the attendance policy eventually may be extended to cover the YoungStars as well.


http://sports.espn.go.com/nhl/allstar2009/news/story?id=3855534
http://www.google.com/hostednews/canadianpress/article/ALeqM5jVIzaYbBIxUkKro5gCLZlnJgVsew
Here is hoping 2009 is a million times better than 2008.

So Jenn decided that this whole drama bullshit isn't for her.

Therefore Jenn's not dealing with it.

Jenn's not going to let it ruin her like it did in high school.

Because kids.... we're not in high school anymore.

And personally Jenn really doesn't care who you are or aren't dating.... or fucking.... or whatev. 

Jenn doesn't need the drama at school or work. 

The past two weeks Jenn has had a lot of time to think about this shit and Jenn just doesn't need it.

With all Jenn has going on right now in her life... money issues.... having to now go 6 days a week to school... and work.... it's just not something Jenn's going to do.

Sooooooo if you have some drama.... save the fucking drama for Osama because Jenn's not going to listen to your drama.

And it's alright, yeah, I'll be fine

Hey!


It's amazing two update within a week. lol.


So Saturday I worked 5-10 and then went to Kelly's Black and White Party.

It was sooo much fun. I learned how to play beer pong and tippy cup. Stephanie and Kelly's friends are soo nice. Justin was cracking me up all night long. Then, after I lost my dear Puff, me and Mary began to hang out. Then Zach renamed us. Zach was Stevie Wonder. Mary was Elvis Presly. I was originally named Boy George then changed to Jimi Hendrix. I met this really nice guy named Mike. It was just such a blast. Good times.


I'm kinda sick now.


Later-
Jenn

Long time not update...


Still working at Kroger but not for long.


I've been applying everywhere...


I'm still at cosmo school.


I'm looking at an early october grad date.


I've become really good friends with these girls Stephanie, Katie and Sue.


The girls at school are really nice.


I got an extreme make-over the other day... lol... I'll post pics on my myspace when I get them.


I've learned a lot about myself the past few months.


I enjoy reading now... I never liked reading... lol... I love Nicholas Sparks' books.


I rarely see my other friends because of schedule conflicts (i.e. usually when I have off is when they already have plans)


I really think I've grown up a lot since I started school. Getting away from the high school drama has been great. I still get intrigued by it but I don't participate in it.


-F-Y-I-        PERMS FUCKING SUCK!! 


And I happen to be getting sick. The End.

Later,
Jen
